Seems there is no others in this academy~ Just like the old movies~
现在看来，整个学园似乎只剩下我们两个了呢~还真是如同电影一般的桥段啊~
やっぱり、この学園で生き延びたのって私たち2人だけみたい。何だが、まるで映画みたいなシチュエーションだね。

As I thought, looks like it's just the two of us left in the entire academy. It's like something out of a movie.
Parece que somos apenas nós dois em toda a academia. Isso é como em um filme...
Now it seems that only the two of us are left in the whole school~ It's really a movie-like scene~
It seems that we are the only two survivors in this school. I don't know what to say, but this situation is just like a movie.

그런, 내 탓으로…… 꺅! 키아나 씨, 왜 갑자기 볼을 꼬집어요!?
Sure enough, it's all my fault... Ah! Kiana-san, why did you pinch my face all of a sudden?!
Com certeza, é tudo por minha causa.. Ah! Kiana, por que você beliscou meu rosto?
Sure enough...it's all because of me ...... ah! Kiana, why are you pinching my face?

Just a small punishment, don't blame on yourself~ I said this already: Those people who can't stay alive were lost their beliefs.
这是对某个还在自责的学姐的惩罚哦~不是已经说过了嘛，那些没有能够活下来的人，都是早已失去了信念的人。在我看来，她们活着或是死去都没有任何区别。
これは未だにクヨクヨしてる先輩への罰だよっ！言ったでしょ？生き残ることができなかったのは、意志を失った人たちだって。あと「さん」はいらないからね！
이건 아직도 꾸물거리는 선배에 대한 벌이야! 말했잖아? 살아남지 못한 건 의지를 잃은 사람들이라고. 그리고 「씨」는 필요 없으니까!

That's punishment for a certain senpai who's still blaming herself for everything! Don't you remember? I told you, the ones who didn't survive were the ones who lost their will to live. And there's no need for that "-san"!

Isso é punição para uma certa Senpai que não consegue parar de se culpar por tudo. Já lhe disse que as pessoas que não sobreviveram não o fizeram porque perderam a vontade. Na minha opinião, não faz diferença se eles estão vivos ou não.

This is the punishment for a certain sister who is still blaming herself ~ it has been said that those who did not survive are those who have long lost their faith. In my opinion, it makes no difference if they live or die.
This is punishment for the senpai who are still in a funk! I told you. Those who could not survive are those who lost their will. And you don't need "san"!

Mei-senpai! Este não é mais o mundo pacífico ao qual você está acostumado! Todo este lugar foi engolido pelo Honkai. Se você não pode mudar sua mentalidade, você também será engolido pela Vontade do Honkai!

Mei Senpai! This world is no longer peaceful. At least, it has completely "collapsed" here. If you keep on being sad, you'll be swallowed up by the collapse again!

Kiana, follow me. I'm familiar with this building, there is a way to the side door.
琪亚娜，不如让我走在前面带路吧。我对这栋实验楼还是蛮熟悉的，这里有一条通道通往学园侧门。
キアナちゃん、それなら私に任せて。この辺の実験棟には、ちょっとだけ詳しいの。この先に通用門があるから、そこから出られるはずよ。
키아나 쨩, 그렇다면 나에게 맡겨. 이 근처 실험동에는 조금 자세히 알고 있거든. 앞에 통용문이 있으니까 거기로 나갈 수 있을 거야.
Kiana-chan, why don't you let me take the lead? I'm quite familiar with the lab building here. There's a passage inside leading to the side entrance of the academy that should get us out.
Kiana, por que você não me deixa assumir a liderança? Estou bastante familiarizado com este prédio de laboratório, há uma passagem que leva à entrada lateral da academia.
Kiana, why don't you let me walk ahead and lead the way. I am still quite familiar with this lab building, and there is a passage leading to the side entrance of the academy.

Huh? I thought this was a restricted area. Students aren't supposed to be allowed in here, right?

Well, it's true that this is one of the forbidden areas of the school, but that's only for students in general. For me, it's not as restrictive.
Bem, é verdade que esta é uma das áreas proibidas da escola, mas é apenas para alunos em geral. Para mim, não é tão restritivo.
Well, it's true that this is one of the restricted areas of the school, but that's only for students in general, and it's probably not as binding for me.
Yes, Kiana, you are right, this is one of the off-limits areas. But it's only for regular students, and I'm an exception.
msg
Actually… This laboratory is sponsored by my family. My father made great contribution to establish this academy.
其实…这座实验室，甚至这所学园都是由我家的家族企业资助建设的。而我的父亲雷电龙马则是推动千羽学园成立的主导人。
実はこの実験棟……というより、この学園自体がうちの会社の出資で建てられたの。つまり、私のお父様——雷電龍馬が千羽学園を作った人なのよ。
사실 이 실험동...이라기보다, 이 학원 자체가 우리 회사의 출자로 지어진 거야. 즉, 나의 아버지——라이덴 료마가 센바 학원을 만든 사람이시란 거지.
Actually, this laboratory building... or rather, this school itself was built with funding from our company. In other words, my father, Raiden Ryoma, was the one who founded Senba Academy.

Na verdade... este laboratório, e até mesmo esta academia, foi financiado e construído pelo negócio da minha família. E meu pai, Raiden Ryoma, foi o maior contribuinte para promover o estabelecimento da Academia Senba.

In fact...this laboratory, and even this academy, was built with the financial support of my family business. And my father, Raiden Ryoma, was the leading person who promoted the establishment of Chihaya Academy.
Actually, rather than this experimental building ......, this academy itself was built with our company's investment. In other words, my father--Ryoma Raiden--is the one who built Senba Academy.

에엣!! 역시 ME사네요. 학교를 통째로 하나 지어버리다니, 무서운 회사에요.

ただの電子企業で、大したことないのよ。それよりも、今はここから脱出しましょう。ね？
그냥 전자 기업일 뿐인데, 대단한 건 아니야. 그보다 지금은 여기서 탈출하자. 응?

17: えっ？な、何？キアナちゃん？
엣? 무, 무슨 일이야 키아나 쨩?
Hum? Qual é o problema, Kiana?
不是啦~就是看到学姐你一直愁眉苦脸的，想问问你怎么了。
べつに～、ただ先輩がずっと暗そうにしてるから、どうしたのかなーと思って。
별거 아냐~ 그냥 선배가 계속 어두운 표정을 하고 있어서, 무슨 일인가 싶어서.
Nothing really~ I was just wondering what's wrong, since you look so down, Senpai.
Ah não é nada, é só que você parecia triste então eu queria te perguntar o que há de errado.
No, it's just that you've been looking so sad, I wanted to ask you what's wrong.
Nothing - I just wondered what was wrong with my senior since he looked so gloomy all the time.
Nothing… I just missed my father so much…
没什么…只是想起了我的父亲……
ごめんなさい……ちょっと、お父様のことを思い出してたの……。
Sorry... I'm just... thinking of my father...
Não é nada... Só estou... Pensando no meu pai.
I'm sorry ...... I was just thinking about your father .......
When a was a little girl, my father is always working in his laboratory…
我记得在我小的时候，父亲就一直在做实验，仿佛实验就是他的全部一样……
私が小さかった頃、お父様っていつも実験室にこもっていたの。お父様にとって、実験は何よりも大切だったみたい……。
내가 어렸을 때, 아버지는 항상 실험실에 틀어박혀 계셨던 거야. 아버지에게는 실험이 무엇보다 중요했던 모양이야...
I remember when I was little, my father would always be holed up in his lab, experimenting. It was as if experiments were all he ever had...
Eu me lembro quando eu ainda era criança, meu pai sempre fazia experimentos, como se experimentos fossem tudo o que ele tinha......
I remember when I was little, my father was always doing experiments, as if experiments were all he had ......
When I was little, my father was always holed up in his laboratory. For him, experimentation was more important than anything else. ......
I got education from teachers, I don't have any friend, I can only speak to my jodo teacher…
我受到的教育也都是父亲请来的专门的老师，我没有一个朋友，只有一个教我剑道的老师能和我说上话……
勉強はお父様の雇った専門の先生から教わったわ。だから、私に友達なんて一人もいなかった。唯一、お喋りしてくれたのが剣術の先生だけ……。
공부는 아버지가 고용한 전문 선생님께 배웠어. 그래서 나에게는 친구라고는 하나도 없었지. 유일하게 이야기해주던 건 검술 선생님뿐이었어...
I was taught by specialized teachers hired by my father. So I never had a single friend. The only person I could confide in was my swordsmanship teacher...
Fui ensinado pelos professores particulares que meu pai contratou e nunca tive amigos. A única pessoa com quem eu podia falar era meu professor de Kendo.
I was also educated by special teachers hired by my father, I did not have a friend, only a teacher who taught me kendo could talk to me ......
I learned my studies from a specialized teacher hired by your father. So I never had any friends. The only one who chatted with me was my swordsmanship teacher. ......
When I grew up, I wanted to get a explanation but I couldn't find my father…
当我长大了，想要询问父亲为什么的时候，他却不见了……
大きくなったら、お父様に理由を尋ねようと思っていたのに……それがいなくなっちゃうなんて、想像もしてなかった……。
커서 아버지께 이유를 물어보려고 했는데... 그렇게 사라져버릴 줄은, 상상도 못했어...
I had always thought that when I grew up, I would ask my father why... but I never imagined that he would disappear...
Quando fiquei mais velho, quis questionar meu pai sobre isso, mas ele sumiu.
When I grew up and wanted to ask my father why, he disappeared ......
When I was growing up, I was going to ask your father why ...... I never imagined it would be gone. ......
ええ、失踪したの。今も行方不明よ。
Yes, he disappeared. He's still missing.
Yeah, he disappeared. She's still missing.
I can't find my father either, I'm looking for him.
我的父亲也失踪了，我到千羽学园来，就是为了找他。
私のパパも失踪したの。千羽学園に来たのもパパを探すため。
내 아빠도 실종됐어. 센바 학원에 온 것도 아빠를 찾으려고.
My dad disappeared, too. That's why I came to Senba Academy, to look for him.
Meu pai também desapareceu, por isso vim para a Academia Chiba , para procurá-lo.
My father also disappeared, and I came to Chihaya Gakuen to find him.
My dad disappeared too. I came to Senba Academy to look for him.
We are in the same boat~
这么说，我们也算是同病相怜呢~
そうだったの……ふふっ、それじゃあ、私たち似た者同士なのね。
그랬구나…… 훗, 그럼 우리 비슷한 처지네.
I see... Heheh, looks like we're in the same boat then.
Parece que estamos no mesmo barco então.
So, we are also considered the same disease it ~
That's what I was thinking ...... Hmmm, so we are similar then.
Yes, so should we make an alliance called "Find father together"?
对呀，我们这样是不是就是“寻找失联父亲少女同盟”呢？
そうだね！さしずめ、私たち「父をたずねて三千里同盟」ってとこかしら！
그렇지! 이제부터 우리는 「아빠 찾아 삼만리 동맹」 이라도 해야겠네!
Yeah! Should we call this the "Searching for Missing Fathers Girls' Alliance"?
Sim, devemos chamar esta aliança de "Aliança das Meninas que  procuram seus Pais Desaparecidos”?
Yes, is this what we call the "Missing Father Girls Alliance"?
Yes, that's right! I guess we are like the "Three Thousand Miles to Find My Father" alliance!
What kind of name is that~?
Que tipo de nome é esse?
What kind of weird names are those?
18: Temperature is lower and lower, I feel like in a icehouse……
气温也越来越低，感觉像是进入了冰室一样……
ふぇ……っくしょん！き、気温がどんどん下がってきてる。まるで、冷凍庫の中に入ったみたい……。
페이……츄! 기, 기온이 점점 떨어지고 있어. 마치 냉동고 안에 들어간 것 같아…….
Ah... achoo! Th-The temperature is dropping rapidly. It feels like we're entering a freezer...
A temperatura também está cada vez mais baixa, parece que estou entrando em um freezer...
The temperature is also getting lower and lower, it feels like entering an ice chamber ......
Whew ......kkk! Ki, the temperature is dropping rapidly. It's as if we're in a freezer. ......
The experiment is weird…… It's not like what my father did before…
这里的实验，好像有些奇怪……好像以前跟以前父亲所做的实验有点不同……
様子が変だわ……ここで行われていた実験、何だかお父様がやっていたものと少し違うみたい……。
분위기가 이상해…… 여기서 진행되던 실험, 뭔가 아버지가 하시던 것과 조금 다른 것 같아…….
Something seems strange... The experiments here seem a little different from the ones Father used to do...
Os experimentos aqui parecem um pouco estranhos, parecem um pouco diferentes dos que meu pai fazia.
The experiment here, seems a little strange ...... seems to be a little different from the previous experiments done by my father ......
There's something strange about the experiments that were being done here ......, something a little different from what your father was doing. ......
Experiment? I feel it's normal… Samples, marks, it's experiment's atmosphere~
实验？我觉得很正常啊…标本什么的，生化符号什么的，倒不如说这样才有实验室的氛围~
実験？ん～、標本とかよくわかんない記号とか、普通の実験室っぽい感じがするけど？
실험? 음~, 표본이랑 잘 모르는 기호 같은 것들로 평범한 실험실 같은 느낌이 드는데?
Experiments? Looks pretty standard to me... Specimens, biochemical symbols, stuff like that. In my opinion, this place gives off serious laboratory vibes~
Experimentos? Parece bastante normal para mim... Espécimes, símbolos bioquímicos, coisas assim. Mais como, este lugar emite vibrações sérias de laboratório ~
Experiment? I think it is normal ah ... specimens and so on, biochemical symbols and so on, rather than say that this is the laboratory atmosphere ~
Experiments? Hmmm...it looks like a normal laboratory, with specimens and symbols I don't understand?
And, I saw marks on every laboratories… I feel…
而且，刚才经过的那些实验室上面好像都有一个标志…总觉得……
違和感は他にもあるの。どの実験室にも同じロゴがあって、それがすごく引っかかるのよ……。
어색한 점은 또 있어. 모든 실험실에 같은 로고가 있어서, 그게 엄청 신경 쓰여…….
There also seems to be a logo above all the lab doors we just passed... It's bugging me...
Além disso, parece haver um logotipo acima de todas as portas do laboratório que acabamos de passar... Isso está me incomodando...
And, just passed by those labs above seems to have a logo ... always feel ......
There are other things that are not quite right. Every lab has the same logo, and it's really bugging me. ......
Maybe it's a kind of your family's mark~
说不定是你家公司内部的什么标记啦，学姐你不用在意的~
んー、先輩んとこの会社のロゴじゃないかな？気にする必要ないと思うけど。
음, 선배네 회사 로고 아닐까? 신경 쓸 필요 없을 것 같은데.
Hmm, maybe it's a logo from your company? You don't need to worry about it, Senpai~
Talvez seja um logotipo da sua empresa? Não se preocupe com isso, senpai~
Maybe it's your company's internal markings, you don't have to care ~
Hmmm...isn't that the logo of my senior's company? I don't think you need to worry about it.
……そうよね、きっと私の思い過ごしよね。
...You're right, I'm probably just imagining things.
...... I know, I'm sure I'm missing something.
I remember once we go through the warehouse, we can go out from the side gate.
我记得穿过前面的仓库，就可以从侧门逃出去了。
この先の倉庫を抜ければ、通用門から脱出できるはずよ。
이 앞에 있는 창고만 빠져나가면, 통용문으로 탈출할 수 있을 거야.
If I recall correctly, we must go through the warehouse up ahead, then escape through the side gate.
Lembro-me de passar pelo armazém da frente para sair pela porta lateral.
I remember going through the front warehouse and escaping through the side door.
If we can get past the warehouse up ahead, we should be able to escape through the service gate.
学姐，你有没有听见什么声音？
Sister, did you hear any sound?
Is that the sound of zombies?
这……莫非是那些死士追过来了？
まさか……ゾンビが追ってきたのかしら？
Don't tell me... the zombies are coming after us?
Este som- Os zumbis podem estar vindo atrás de nós?
This ...... could be those dead soldiers chasing over?
Don't tell me ...... zombies are after you?
No, that's not zombies, I think it's the sound of some animals? It's from warehouse.
不，那不是死士的声音，倒像是某种动物在行动的声音，就是从仓库那边传来的。
ううん、ゾンビが出すような音じゃない。動物の足音のような……あっちの方から聞こえる。
아냐, 좀비가 내는 소리 같지 않아. 동물 발소리 같은…… 저쪽에서 들려오는 거야.
No, that's not what zombies sound like. That's more like the sound of an animal moving... It came from the direction of the warehouse.
Não, não é assim que os zumbis soam. Era mais como o som de um animal se movendo e vinha da direção do armazém.
No, it wasn't the sound of a dead man, but rather the sound of some kind of animal in action, coming right from the warehouse side.
No, it doesn't sound like something a zombie would make. It sounds like animal footsteps ...... coming from over there.
Animals? Can we go to check it?
这个地方怎么会有动物…要不我们过去看看？
どうして、こんな所に動物が……キアナちゃん、どうするの？
왜, 이런 곳에 동물이…… 키아나, 어떻게 할 거야?
How could there be animals in a place like this... How about we go and have a look?
Como pode haver animais em um lugar como este... Que tal irmos dar uma olhada?
How can there be animals in this place...why don't we go over there and take a look?
Why are there animals here ...... Kiana, what are you going to do?
Let's go to check the warehouse.
现在折返回去只怕会遭遇更多的死士…那就去仓库那边看看吧。
ここで引き返してもゾンビに囲まれるだけだし……音の方に行ってみましょう。
여기서 돌아가도 좀비에게 포위될 뿐이야…… 소리 나는 쪽으로 가 보자.
Well, I have a feeling that if we turn back now, we'll just be faced with more zombies, so... I guess we could go check the warehouse out!
Bem, tenho a sensação de que, se voltarmos agora, enfrentaremos mais zumbis, então... vamos verificar o armazém!
Now turn back only to encounter more dead soldiers ... then go to the warehouse side to see.
If we turn back here, we'll just be surrounded by zombies. ...... Let's go to the sound.
